meanings.definition: Begin or cause to begin again.
meanings.sent1: She decided to reinitiate her workout routine after taking a break.
meanings.sent2: The teacher had to reinitiate the experiment due to an error.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to reinitiate the game of fetch with its owner.
meanings.sent4: The sun's rays seemed to reinitiate life in the dormant garden.
meanings.sent5: The chef had to reinitiate the cooking process from scratch.

meanings.definition: Start or cause to start again.
meanings.sent1: He pressed the button to reinitiate the machine.
meanings.sent2: The storm caused the power outage, so they had to reinitiate the generator.
meanings.sent3: The children wanted to reinitiate the game of tag for the third time.
meanings.sent4: The music seemed to reinitiate the memories of their first dance.
meanings.sent5: The coach had to reinitiate the team's training schedule after the break.
